se350.elevatorSim.build

Class Building

  • java.lang.Object
    • se350.elevatorSim.build.Building

  • public class Building
extends java.lang.Object
    Building the container for the entire Elevator simulation, creating and holding all of the elevators and initializing the FloorManager.
    Author:
    Shahzaib Syed & James R Hagle

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Building(java.lang.String inputFile)
      Creates a Building instance which creates/holds all of the elevators, initializes the FloorManager, and then begins the simulation by starting a thread for each elevator.
      Building(java.lang.String inputFile, boolean isTesting)
      Constructor used ONLY for debugging purposes.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static int getCurrentTime()
      Get current time in the simulation, specified by simulated seconds
      static int getTimeScale()
      Get the time scale of the simulation, the larger the number, the faster the simulation is compared to real time.
      static java.lang.String getTimeString()
      Keeps track of simulation time, useful for logging.
      static boolean isRunning()
      Get whether the simulation is still running or over.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Building

        public Building(java.lang.String inputFile)
         throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                InvalidParameterException,
                java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Creates a Building instance which creates/holds all of the elevators, initializes the FloorManager, and then begins the simulation by starting a thread for each elevator.
        Parameters:
        inputFile - - The input file to get the data from.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException - when floors < 2 or number of elevators < 1
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the specified file is not valid
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

      • Building

        public Building(java.lang.String inputFile,
        boolean isTesting)
         throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                InvalidParameterException,
                java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Constructor used ONLY for debugging purposes. DOES NOt begin the simulation, rather waits for input from test cases.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException
        InvalidParameterException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

    • Method Detail

      • getTimeString

        public static java.lang.String getTimeString()
        Keeps track of simulation time, useful for logging.
        Returns:
        A String formatting of the current hour, minute and second in hh:mm:ss:sss format

      • getTimeScale

        public static int getTimeScale()
        Get the time scale of the simulation, the larger the number, the faster the simulation is compared to real time.
        Returns:
        The number of simulated seconds that correspond to actual seconds.

      • isRunning

        public static boolean isRunning()
        Get whether the simulation is still running or over.
        Returns:
        True if the simulation is running, false if it is over

      • getCurrentTime

        public static int getCurrentTime()
        Get current time in the simulation, specified by simulated seconds
        Returns:
        The number of simulated seconds gone by since it began
